subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Whistleblower's Dilemma: Snowden, Manning, and Reality Winner
description: One-minute skill: The Whistleblower's Dilemma: Snowden, Manning, and Reality Winner.

hook.text: Edward Snowden revealed mass surveillance. He's called a hero by some and a traitor by others. Who's right?

buildup.text: Whistleblowers expose government or corporate wrongdoing. In cybersecurity, this often means revealing.

discovery.text: The Espionage Act (1917) doesn't distinguish between leaking to journalists and selling secrets to enemies.

twist.text: Reality Winner leaked a single classified document about Russian election interference. She got 5 years in prison..

climax.text: The ethics of whistleblowing forces a choice: obey the law and let wrongdoing continue, or break it and.

punchline.text: Hero or traitor? The answer depends on who you ask.

quiz.question: Why do cybersecurity whistleblowers face severe legal consequences?
options: Whistleblowing is illegal in all countries
Laws like the Espionage Act don't distinguish between whistleblowing and espionage
